On the 26th May, Motamedy, Head of our Department at the Ministry of Foreign Affairs, read out to Trott a communication from the Ministry of tfar to the effect that sailors at Bushire, not employed in official forces, were wearing clothes which were very similar to the uniforms of ratings of the Iranian Navy. In particular the crew of the Residency launch wore clothes with a turn-down collar with three white stripes on it and 'blue cuffs. This was very like the uniform of similar ranks in their l\avy. The Ministry of V/ar thought that, in order to distinguish 'between the two, it would 'be a good thing if the launch crew were to alter some of the details of their uniform; in particular to substitute some other colour for 'blue on their collars and cuffs, and to have one stripe instead of three on their collars. Trott said that he supposed that the launch crew had worn their clothes long before the Iranian Navy existed. Motamedy took the line that this might be so but the launch crew’s uniform was esentially a private one, and that it was desirable that it should not be liable to be mistaken for the official naval uniform. He asked therefore that the alterations indicated above should be made in it. 3/ The Honourable Lieutenant Colonel T.C.W. Fowle, Political Resident in the Persian Gulf, Bushire.* 2. This is an annoying and rather cool request. It is one thing to flatter hy imitation, and quite another to ask that the Paris model, after one has copied it, should he changed. But prima facie it seems not altogether unreasonaLle and my feeling is that it is the kind of request that should he complied with unless it involves great inconvenience. Perhaps you would let me know in due course what you feel about it. 3. I am sending copies of this despatch to Rendel and Caroe. (Signed) Nevile Butler

titleInfo.title: Coll 29/84 'Bushire Residency launch: Persian request for alteration of uniform of crew'

physicalDescription.extent: The papers are arranged in approximate chronological order from the rear to the front of the file.

Foliation: the foliation sequence (used for referencing) commences at the inside front cover with 1, and terminates at the inside back cover with 34; these numbers are written in pencil, are circled, and are located in the top right corner of the recto side of each folio.

mods.abstract: The file concerns a Persian request for alteration of the uniforms worn by the crew of the Bushire Residency boat, which were too similar to those of the Iranian Navy.The file is composed of correspondence between the Government of India, the Foreign Office, the India Office, the Political Residency in the Persian Gulf, and the British Legation at Tehran.
